{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3373797,"name":"Jeffrey","username":"Jeef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeef/{size}/212952_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-25T21:29:08.562Z","cooked":"

Hi from 6036! Just want to post our cool scouting visualizations of shot location and heatmap. Green means successful shots, red means failed. We attended Port Hueneme, Arizona Valley, Idaho, and World (Archimedes). Enjoy!

Hueneme:

data-hueneme1920×963 96 KB

Arizona:

data-arizona1920×958 92.2 KB

Idaho:

data-idaho1920×961 98.2 KB

Worlds:

data-archimedes1920×958 106 KB

Midfield shots? Scouters being bad - ignore those! (Scouters moment)

this is a sick visualization, how does the scout interface look for recording this data? also how useful was this statistic for alliance selection and match strategy?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":38,"updated_at":"2024-04-25T22:19:34.301Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":642,"readers_count":641,"score":243.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464551,"topic_slug":"scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58413,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 strategy lead"},"post_url":"/t/scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024/464551/4","custom_user_title":"3128 strategy lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3373884,"name":"Jeffrey","username":"Jeef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeef/{size}/212952_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-25T23:02:52.549Z","cooked":"

You can see where a bot can / cannot shoot from easily, so you can defend them at strong positions or force them into weaker positions. You could also instantly see whether a bot was a subwoofer-only bot or could shoot from wing line. This is the composite of all bots in the competition, but you can select to see individual teams.

Is it like a field map and they click where it is on the map?

And then I guess the scouter just clicks on the spot?
Also have you attended any events with bad enthernet, and that you had problems sending data? (I assume it is way more data than just quantity numbers)

Since we use scouting tablets, the devices actually have zero internet connection whatsoever. So, what happens is at the end of a match, a QR code is generated, and a scout leader would use their phone to scan and upload the data.

Thanks!
We are now in the procces of looking which languages and data frames would be the best for us.
As of right now we see Flutter as a really good option, yet I see you used js, would you recommend using it?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":38,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T00:56:29.501Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":416,"readers_count":415,"score":103.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464551,"topic_slug":"scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024","display_username":"Amit sucher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63757,"username":"Jeef","name":"Jeffrey","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeef/{size}/212952_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amit 6738"},"post_url":"/t/scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024/464551/13","custom_user_title":"Amit 6738","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374035,"name":"Jeffrey","username":"Jeef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeef/{size}/212952_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:00:05.471Z","cooked":"

In my honest opinion, any framework should work perfectly fine. I just personally don’t use frameworks often, and so, am not really familiar with them. Flutter seems like a great idea, though my one issue with it is the fact that you must use either Dart or C++ (no hate for C++). However, Flutter probably deploys much better to Android than a web app.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":38,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T01:00:05.471Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":100.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464551,"topic_slug":"scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024","display_username":"Jeffrey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55442,"username":"AmitSucher","name":"Amit sucher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amitsucher/{size}/257401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024/464551/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374124,"name":"Daniel Kou","username":"republic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/republic/{size}/225626_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T02:51:14.309Z","cooked":"

The data’s purpose is to provide a general idea of what a bot can/can’t do. After all, it’s not easy to eyeball distances from the stands. Quickly knowing whether or not a bot has the flexibility to shoot at different positions and ranges is very helpful to our strategy people!

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":38,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T02:51:14.309Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":368,"readers_count":367,"score":88.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":464551,"topic_slug":"scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024","display_username":"Daniel Kou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62505,"username":"aven","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aven/{size}/261990_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54591,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I love C++"},"post_url":"/t/scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024/464551/15","custom_user_title":"I love C++","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374322,"name":"Stephen Ostermiller","username":"stephen.ostermiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stephen.ostermiller/{size}/188076_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T12:00:46.874Z","cooked":"

Another tip for storing the data from heat maps: store all the coordinates as percentages of the image width and height. Like 50x50 would be right in the middle of the image.

Doing it that way allows you to use responsive web design, resize the images for different sized screens, and still get consistent data from different sized clickable images.

We do this in our scouting app and it has worked really well.

Hey @Jeef me again , we started doing the testing for the scouting and strategy app, and I was wondering what do you guys use to take data from the DB to the strategy site.
I found a method to do that, but it only gets the curremt data if you deploy it and if new data comes and you have not deployed it, it wont be there.
So I am not sure how good would it be in a competition.

So yeah, what do you guys use to send data from the DB to the strategy site?

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":38,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T15:28:17.510Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":297,"readers_count":296,"score":94.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464551,"topic_slug":"scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024","display_username":"Amit sucher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amit 6738"},"post_url":"/t/scouting-data-scoring-heatmap-2024/464551/19","custom_user_title":"Amit 6738","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3398312,"name":"Jeffrey","username":"Jeef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeef/{size}/212952_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-13T02:12:27.315Z","cooked":"

Our scouting app has a refresh feature that polls a web endpoint for a JSON of the scouting data. This is sometimes done automatically but can also be activated by a button. However, this data isn’t updated fully automatically in the background (aka every 10s), so if new data is uploaded to the web endpoint, the app won’t know that anything has changed. You need to manually refresh whenever that occurs. This is because wifi at competitions is usually limited so frequent requests can become straining on whatever hotspot you are using.

TL;DR: a JSON is requested. Nothing overly fancy.
